instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01958: What is 820-01958? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_G3H_RTC: What is PP3V3_G3H_RTC? PP3V3_G3H_RTC Is one of the first rails that has to come on in order for the USB-C mux chip to be powered in the T2 chip Macbook Pros..
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.3V3_G3H_RTC: What is 3V3_G3H_RTC? 3V3_G3H_RTC Is an abbreviation of PP3V3_G3H_RTC which is one of the first rails that has to come on in order for the USB-C mux chip to be powered in the T2 chip Macbook Pros..
definitions.C7020: What is C7020? Capacitor between current sense lines on ISL6259 chip for charger current sensing, you should measure around 20.02 ohms across this. Often when the resistance across this capacitor is higher it is because one of the current sense resistors going to the ISL6259 chip has failed. When current sensing resistors between the shunt resistor and the ISL6259 power IC have failed the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing as much power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Power Stuck 5V 0.00A
threads.message:
So i've got an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damaged and it's stuck at 5V 0A - it's been ultrasonic cleaned and looks good now. Only real area of corrosion was around <CHIP>U6960</CHIP> where we had <RESISTOR>R6960</RESISTOR> loose and has been replaced. All other resistors are connected and measuring normally. 

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 12.3V
Device is not detected in DFU mode when connected to another mac
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL> is missing and is not shorted to ground
<SIGNAL>CHGR_EN_MVR</SIGNAL> is also missing and is not shorted to ground
<CHIP>U6960</CHIP> has been removed and resoldered - there was no corrosion underneath.

Unsure about this one as 12.3v PPBUS would indicate T2 communication issue but also got missing <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL> and i'm not sure if that should only come up after PPBUS voltage goes up.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Power Stuck 5V 0.00A
threads.message:
T2 can't work without <SIGNAL>3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL>.
Change <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>; or remove and resolder it first.
May have accumulated crap underneath.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Power Stuck 5V 0.00A
threads.message: I'll order a new <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> and try that first

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Power Stuck 5V 0.00A
threads.message: <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> replaced and same behaviour - it has made no difference.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Power Stuck 5V 0.00A
threads.message:
Post <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> basic voltages; <SIGNAL>P_IN</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>AUX_DET</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>SMC_RST_IN</SIGNAL>, VDDA/P, <SIGNAL>CBC_ON</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>EN_MVR</SIGNAL>, A/BMON.
Be sure to have correct resistance over <CAPACITOR>C7020</CAPACITOR>/23.
